definitions: relating to or denoting the everyday language and culture of ordinary people
denoting or relating to simplified cursive form of ancient Egyptian hieratic script
examples: He wrote in a demotic style that everyone could understand
The politician's demotic appeal won over many working-class voters
The demotic script was easier to write than traditional hieroglyphics
Scholars study demotic texts to understand daily Egyptian life

definitions: having been rendered unfit for consumption by adding toxic or unpalatable substances
having lost natural qualities or characteristics through chemical or physical processing
examples: Denatured alcohol cannot be consumed safely by humans
The laboratory uses denatured proteins for certain experiments
The denatured landscape looked nothing like its original state
Industrial processing left the food denatured and lacking nutrients

definitions: relating to or according to the principles of a particular religious denomination or sect
examples: The denominational school follows Catholic teaching principles strictly
They avoided denominational conflicts by focusing on shared beliefs
The community center welcomes people regardless of denominational affiliation
Denominational differences divided the congregation into separate churches

definitions: closely compacted in substance with parts crowded together
difficult to understand because of complexity or obscurity of content
informal showing slowness to understand things or lacking intelligence
examples: The dense forest made it hard to see ahead
Traffic was dense during the morning rush hour
The professor's dense lecture confused most of the students
The legal document contained dense technical language
He felt dense for not understanding the simple instructions
Don't be so dense - the answer is obvious

definitions: relating to the teeth or to dentistry and dental care
examples: She scheduled her annual dental checkup for next week
Good dental hygiene prevents many health problems
The dental surgeon specialized in complex tooth extractions
Most insurance plans cover basic dental procedures

definitions: marked or damaged with a hollow or depression in the surface
examples: The dented car door needed expensive bodywork repairs
He found a dented can at the grocery store
The boxer's dented pride took longer to heal than bruises
Years of use left the metal surface thoroughly dented

definitions: stripped of covering or possessions leaving bare or exposed
examples: The denuded hillside showed severe erosion after logging
Winter left the trees denuded of their leaves
The storm denuded the beach of its protective sand dunes
Years of overgrazing had denuded the pasture completely

definitions: euphemistic term for someone who has died recently
having left or gone away from a place
examples: We gathered to honor our departed friend's memory
The departed souls were remembered in the memorial service
The departed guests left the party venue in disarray
By noon, all the departed visitors had reached home

definitions: in the act of leaving or going away from a place
examples: The departing train whistled as it left the station
Departing employees must return their security badges
She waved goodbye to her departing friends at the airport
The departing ship slowly disappeared beyond the horizon

definitions: relating to or concerning a specialized division of a large organization
examples: The departmental meeting addressed budget concerns for next quarter
Each departmental head submitted their annual report
Departmental rivalries sometimes hindered company-wide cooperation efforts
The new departmental structure improved internal communication significantly

definitions: able to be relied on as consistent, trustworthy, or accurate
examples: She's a dependable employee who never misses deadlines
We need dependable transportation for the long journey
His dependable nature made him the perfect team leader
The old car remained dependable despite its age

definitions: shown or represented by a drawing, painting, or other artistic work
examples: The mural depicted scenes from the city's history
Ancient cave paintings depicted hunting scenes and animals
The novel depicted life in Victorian England with accuracy
The chart depicted rising temperatures over fifty years

definitions: having been reduced in number or quantity through use or consumption
examples: The depleted water reserves worried the drought-stricken farmers
After the marathon, her energy was completely depleted
Overfishing has left fish stocks dangerously depleted worldwide
The depleted uranium posed environmental concerns for decades

definitions: deserving strong condemnation as shockingly bad in quality or morally wrong
examples: The deplorable conditions in the factory sparked public outrage
His deplorable behavior at dinner embarrassed everyone present
The report revealed deplorable treatment of elderly residents
Living in such deplorable poverty affected children's health

definitions: having lost inhabitants through death, migration, or other population reduction
examples: The depopulated village stood empty after the evacuation
War left many regions depopulated and economically devastated
Rural areas became depopulated as people moved to cities
The depopulated island struggled to maintain basic services

definitions: morally corrupt and wicked showing evil or perverted behavior
examples: The depraved criminal showed no remorse for his actions
Such depraved indifference to suffering shocked the jury
The novel explored the depraved depths of human nature
His depraved lifestyle eventually led to his downfall

definitions: expressing disapproval or criticism of something or someone
belittling or undervaluing oneself in a modest or humorous way
examples: His deprecating remarks about her work hurt her feelings
The critic's deprecating review discouraged the young artist
She made deprecating jokes about her cooking skills
His self-deprecating humor endeared him to the audience

definitions: causing feelings of severe despondency, sadness, or hopelessness
examples: The depressing news about unemployment affected everyone's mood
Rainy weather can be depressing during long winters
The documentary's depressing footage showed environmental destruction clearly
His depressing outlook on life worried his friends

definitions: suffering from lack of basic material and cultural benefits considered necessary
examples: Children from deprived backgrounds often struggle in school
The deprived neighborhood lacked proper healthcare facilities
Years of isolation left him emotionally deprived and lonely
Deprived communities need targeted support and investment programs

definitions: mad, insane, or mentally disturbed unable to think or behave normally
examples: The deranged attacker was detained by security guards
His deranged behavior alarmed everyone at the meeting
The horror movie featured a deranged killer stalking victims
Lack of sleep left her feeling completely deranged

definitions: in very poor condition as result of disuse and neglect
shamefully negligent in not having done what one should do
examples: The derelict building posed safety hazards for neighbors
Urban explorers photographed the derelict amusement park
The guard was derelict in his duty to check credentials
Being derelict in maintenance caused the equipment failure

definitions: expressing contempt or ridicule through mocking or scornful behavior
examples: Her derisive laughter made him feel foolish and small
The crowd responded with derisive shouts and jeers
His derisive comments about her ideas discouraged participation
The critic's derisive tone overshadowed any constructive feedback

definitions: imitative of another work and lacking originality or creativity
obtained from, based on, or developing from something else
examples: Critics dismissed the movie as derivative and predictable
Her derivative art style showed too much influence from others
The derivative product was based on existing technology
Many English words are derivative forms from Latin roots

definitions: obtained or developed from a specified source or origin
examples: The medicine was derived from traditional plant remedies
Much satisfaction can be derived from helping others
These statistics were derived from extensive market research
The word is derived from ancient Greek origins

definitions: relating to or affecting the skin and its layers
examples: The dermal patch delivered medication through the skin
Dermal fillers can reduce the appearance of wrinkles
She studied dermal regeneration in burn victims
The dermal layer contains blood vessels and nerve endings

definitions: relating to dermatology or the medical study and treatment of skin conditions
examples: The dermatological clinic specialized in treating severe acne
She sought dermatological advice for her persistent rash
Recent dermatological research has improved psoriasis treatment options
The hospital expanded its dermatological services last year

definitions: showing a critical or disrespectful attitude intended to belittle or disparage
examples: His derogatory remarks about immigrants offended many people
Using derogatory language in the workplace is unacceptable
The article contained several derogatory references to minorities
She filed a complaint about derogatory comments from colleagues

definitions: coming from an ancestor or proceeding from an earlier form
examples: She discovered she was descendant from colonial settlers
The descendant branches of the family tree spread worldwide
Modern birds are descendant from dinosaur species
These traditions remain descendant through many generations

definitions: moving downward or proceeding from a higher to lower position
examples: The descendent path led steeply into the valley
Descendent air currents brought cooler temperatures overnight
The graph showed a descendent trend in sales figures
They followed the descendent staircase into the basement

definitions: moving down or downward from a higher to lower level
examples: The descending elevator stopped at every floor
Birds were descending to roost for the night
She arranged the numbers in descending order from largest to smallest
The descending fog obscured the mountain road

definitions: having been given a detailed account or representation in words
examples: The witness described events exactly as they happened
The travel guide described local attractions in detail
Scientists described the newly discovered species in journals
The symptoms described matched those of food poisoning

definitions: serving or seeking to give a detailed account or picture in words
examples: Her descriptive writing brought the scene to life
The manual included descriptive diagrams of each part
He used descriptive language to paint vivid mental images
The descriptive catalog helped buyers understand product features

definitions: having been treated with violent disrespect especially toward something sacred
examples: Vandals desecrated graves in the historic cemetery
The desecrated temple required extensive restoration work
Ancient artifacts were desecrated by careless handling
The desecrated monument shocked the local community

definitions: abandoned and empty of people creating an eerie or lonely atmosphere
examples: The deserted streets felt eerie after midnight
They explored the deserted island looking for shelter
The once-busy mall now stood deserted and silent
Heavy rain left the beach completely deserted

definitions: rightfully earned or merited as a consequence of actions or qualities
examples: She received deserved recognition for her hard work
The team's victory was deserved after months of training
His punishment was deserved given the severity of his actions
The restaurant's deserved reputation attracted many customers

definitions: worthy of being given help, praise, or reward due to good qualities
examples: The deserving students received scholarships for college
She's deserving of respect for her community service
Many deserving charities compete for limited donation funds
His deserving case prompted immediate assistance from neighbors

definitions: having been thoroughly dried out with all moisture removed or evaporated
examples: The desiccated coconut added texture to the cake
Desert plants survived despite the desiccated conditions
Archaeologists found desiccated remains in the ancient tomb
The desiccated fruit retained most of its nutrients

definitions: appointed to an office or position but not yet installed
examples: The president designate will take office next month
The designate ambassador prepared for her new posting
The designate chairman met with board members privately
As CEO designate, she began learning company operations

definitions: planned and made for a specific purpose or effect
examples: The building was designed to withstand earthquakes
These shoes are designed for long-distance running
The program was designed with user-friendliness in mind
Specially designed tools made the job much easier

definitions: crafty, scheming, or cunning in achieving personal goals through manipulation
examples: Her designing nature made coworkers distrust her motives
The designing politician manipulated public opinion expertly
He saw through her designing attempts to gain promotion
Such designing behavior eventually ruins professional relationships

definitions: wanted or wished for as being attractive, useful, or necessary
arousing sexual desire or considered sexually attractive
examples: Living downtown became more desirable as commutes grew longer
The job offered desirable benefits including healthcare
He was considered highly desirable by many admirers
The model's desirable features graced magazine covers

definitions: wanted or wished for strongly as a goal or outcome
examples: The medicine produced the desired effect within hours
She finally achieved her desired weight through exercise
The negotiation didn't yield the desired results
Mix ingredients until desired consistency is reached

definitions: having or characterized by strong desire or wish for something
examples: He was desirous of learning new skills for advancement
The company was desirous of expanding into new markets
She remained desirous of reconciliation despite their arguments
Investors were desirous of higher returns on investments

definitions: empty of inhabitants giving an impression of bleak emptiness
feeling or showing profound unhappiness, loneliness, or abandonment
examples: The desolate landscape stretched endlessly before them
After the fire, the neighborhood looked desolate
She felt desolate after her best friend moved away
His desolate expression revealed his inner pain

definitions: showing the complete loss or absence of hope
examples: Her despairing cry echoed through the empty house
The despairing refugees had nowhere else to go
He made one last despairing attempt to save the relationship
The despairing tone of his letter worried his family

definitions: deserving hatred and contempt as morally reprehensible or worthless
examples: His despicable treatment of animals led to criminal charges
Stealing from charity is a despicable act
The villain's despicable plan shocked even his accomplices
Such despicable behavior has no place in society

definitions: regarded with intense dislike, hatred, or contempt
examples: The despised dictator finally fled the country
He was despised by colleagues for his dishonesty
The once despised art style gained appreciation over time
Being despised isolated him from the community

definitions: in low spirits from loss of hope or courage feeling extreme discouragement
examples: She became despondent after failing the exam twice
The despondent team struggled to stay motivated
His despondent mood worried his family and friends
Unemployment left him feeling increasingly despondent

definitions: exercising power in a cruel, oppressive, or tyrannical way
examples: The despotic ruler suppressed all forms of dissent
Her despotic management style demoralized the staff
Despotic governments often face eventual rebellion from citizens
His despotic control over family finances caused resentment

definitions: certain to happen as if determined by fate or destiny
intended or chosen for a particular fate or purpose by destiny
examples: Their business seemed destined to fail from the start
The storm was destined to cause major damage
She felt destined to become a great artist
They seemed destined to meet again someday
